snippet: The time when every action by armed forces brought mass protests, public hand-wringing and questions about Germany’s militarist past is over.
abstract: Every German military action, in the not-too-distant past, brought with it mass demonstrations, public hand-wringing and probing questions about country’s militarist past; but the shadow of history continues to recede and country is, for better or worse, quietly approaching a normal relationship with its armed forces.

byline.contributor: Chris Cottrell and Victor Homola contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: The time when every action by armed forces brought mass protests, public hand-wringing and questions about Germany’s militarist past is over.

headline.seo: Germany Moves Closer to Accepting Military Role
headline.main: Decades of German Pacifism Yield to Bigger Military Role
headline.print_headline: Germany, for Decades a Pacifist Power, Faces the Need to Play a Military Role
